sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky says the war must end with the liberation of Crimea after explosions at a Russian military base in the Moscow-annexed region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Drier and drier, an EU report warns that the current European drought could be the worst in 500 years, with France, Italy, Spain and Portugal bearing the brunt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the rescue operation to save a beluga whale stranded in France's River Seine ends after the mammal dies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Columns of smoke rise over and around Ukraine's town of Bakhmut, where Russian forces step

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: up their advance into the besieged Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Donetsk and Luhansk have weathered the worst of the fighting, as Ukrainian forces try to hold off the continued onslaught in the two war-torn regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even so, emergency services are still sometimes able to get through and treat the wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Both Russia and Ukraine are sticking to their own versions of what caused a series of powerful explosions in Crimea on Tuesday. Russia's MoD denies that the Saki base on the Black Sea was shelled and instead claims that the munitions had blown up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian social networks had been abuzz with speculation that it was hit by a Ukrainian-fired long-range missile, but Kyiv denies involvement in the blast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Vladimir Zelenskyy used his nightly address to comment generally on the situation in Crimea, saying there will be no stable and lasting peace in many countries which border the shores of the Mediterranean Sea as long as Russia is able to use the peninsula as its military base.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials say at least three civilians were killed and 23 wounded by Russian shelling in the last 24 hours, including an attack not far from the Russian-occupied Zaporizhia nuclear plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While international fears of a catastrophe grow if shelling doesn't stop, the governor of the region where the plant is situated has reported radiation levels as normal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: These troops are part of Ukraine's Firefly's reconnaissance team.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They operate drones to identify the position of Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The remote-controlled gadgets are playing a crucial role in Ukraine's military operations, particularly in the Mykolaiv region, where Russia's shelling has been escalating in recent weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is a war of artillery and drones. We aim at artillery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There are a lot of Russians, but we can now shoot very precisely. Last week, the Ukrainian military said it had received nearly 20 million euros from donor countries and individuals for drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They displayed some of the hardware at an airport on the outskirts of Kyiv, ahead of its deployment to the front lines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: at an airport on the outskirts of Kyiv, ahead of its deployment to the front lines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Back in the field, the servicemen monitor their drones and focus their guns at a practice target.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is a conflict where technology, once used for entertainment, has become part of a war machine. A signature for history, US President Joe Biden has ratified the treaty that would expand NATO to include Sweden and Finland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Already more than 20 of the alliance's 30 members have done so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Against the backdrop of the war in Ukraine, Biden has delivered a message of security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And through more than seven decades as follows, NATO has proved the indispensable alliance committed to Europe whole, free and at peace. Our alliance is closer than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Our alliance is closer than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is more united than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And when Finland and Sweden bring the number of allies to 32, we'll be stronger than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Stronger than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A sentiment shared by Democrats and Republicans in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Last week, the Senate approved NATO enlargement by an overwhelming and rare majority of 95 votes in favour and one against.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Severe drought will worsen in Europe this month as a hot and dry summer persists. That's according to a new report by the European Commission Joint Research Centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Italy is among the most affected as well as southern France and large areas of Spain and Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Commission has confirmed the whole of Europe is being affected by long spells without rain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Our analysis indeed is pointing to extremely low flow affecting almost all the European rivers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Just to mention a few, the Rhine river for instance, that is causing big troubles for instance in the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France is in the midst of a fourth heatwave of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The government says soaring temperatures and lack of rain is causing its worst drought on record.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meteo France says the heatwave which began in the south is expected to spread across the country and last until the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The heat is drying up crops such as lavender and sunflowers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Even in the UK, which is not known for its hot summers, a four-day extreme heat warning of more than 35 degrees Celsius has been issued once again for southern and central England starting Thursday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With some reservoirs recording low water levels, hosepipe bans are being extended across the country and in Wales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Germany's Rhine, one of Europe's key waterways, could be just days away from being closed to commercial traffic because of very low levels caused by drought.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's the warning from authorities and industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Two and a half metres is the sufficient water level for smooth inland navigation on the Rhine River, but the water level in Kaab is currently only 51 centimeters and inland navigation is becoming more difficult this means that we still have to look at every voyage every order we accept how much water do we still have in the middle right section that's the sticking point for us because of the low water levels navigation of the Rhine is limited the transport capacity of the inland water levels, navigation of the Rhine is limited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The transport capacity of the inland fleet is slower, and therefore that also means that all those who calculate goods and services from the waterway have lower supply possibilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Rhine runs through six countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Calculations by the Commission on the Hydrology of the River predict that low levels could affect the waterway more frequently in the future. France's nuclear power regulator has given the green light to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: five nuclear plants to discharge hot water into its rivers as the global energy crisis continues. Authorities issued the temporary measures for the plants despite concerns over environmental standards. Experts fear the move could alter the habitat of fish and plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Water that is discharged with a temperature above 30 degrees Celsius or even higher means that physically it has lower oxygen content.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fish need oxygen, as we all do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nuclear plant production usually slows down during the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But during the energy crisis sparked by the war in Ukraine, the French government has opted for nuclear to preserve gas given their locations and cooling systems the five atomic power stations are usually affected by our environmental limits the move is expected to bring some relief to the European power market where heat waves have sent prices soaring due to river disruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sizzling temperatures are expected to hit France, the UK and Germany this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Water levels in some of Europe's most important rivers are so low that they now risk closure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A beluga whale has died after being removed from the Seine River in France, after more than a week in fresh water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The protected animal was pulled from the river after divers worked for six hours to lure him into a net.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For several minutes, the whale, which weighs 800 kilograms, was suspended in the air after being removed from the water some 70 kilometers from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The beluga whale was originally going to be observed for two to three days before being released into the English Channel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The marine mammal is usually found in Arctic waters and he was stuck in the river for over a week before he died.
